018package org.apache.hadoop.hbase.master.janitor;
019
020import static org.junit.Assert.assertEquals;
021import static org.junit.Assert.assertFalse;
022import static org.junit.Assert.assertNotNull;
023import static org.junit.Assert.assertTrue;
024
025import java.io.IOException;
026import java.util.Arrays;
027import java.util.LinkedList;
028import java.util.List;
029import org.apache.hadoop.hbase.HBaseClassTestRule;
030import org.apache.hadoop.hbase.HBaseTestingUtility;
031import org.apache.hadoop.hbase.HConstants;
032import org.apache.hadoop.hbase.MetaTableAccessor;
033import org.apache.hadoop.hbase.TableName;
034import org.apache.hadoop.hbase.TableNotEnabledException;
035import org.apache.hadoop.hbase.client.Put;
036import org.apache.hadoop.hbase.client.RegionInfo;
037import org.apache.hadoop.hbase.client.RegionInfoBuilder;
038import org.apache.hadoop.hbase.master.assignment.RegionStateStore;
039import org.apache.hadoop.hbase.testclassification.LargeTests;
040import org.apache.hadoop.hbase.testclassification.MasterTests;
041import org.apache.hadoop.hbase.util.Bytes;
042import org.apache.hadoop.hbase.util.EnvironmentEdgeManager;
043import org.apache.hadoop.hbase.util.Pair;
044import org.junit.After;
045import org.junit.Before;
046import org.junit.ClassRule;
047import org.junit.Rule;
048import org.junit.Test;
049import org.junit.experimental.categories.Category;
050import org.junit.rules.TestName;
051import org.slf4j.Logger;
052import org.slf4j.LoggerFactory;
053
054@Category({ MasterTests.class, LargeTests.class })
055public class TestCatalogJanitorCluster {
056  private static final Logger LOG = LoggerFactory.getLogger(TestCatalogJanitorCluster.class);
057
058  @ClassRule
059  public static final HBaseClassTestRule CLASS_RULE =
060    HBaseClassTestRule.forClass(TestCatalogJanitorCluster.class);
061
062  @Rule
063  public final TestName name = new TestName();
064
065  private final static HBaseTestingUtility TEST_UTIL = new HBaseTestingUtility();
066  private static final TableName T1 = TableName.valueOf("t1");
067  private static final TableName T2 = TableName.valueOf("t2");
068  private static final TableName T3 = TableName.valueOf("t3");
069  private static final TableName T4 = TableName.valueOf("t4");
070  private static final TableName T5 = TableName.valueOf("t5");
071  private static final TableName T6 = TableName.valueOf("t6");
072  private static final TableName T7 = TableName.valueOf("t7");
073
074  @Before
075  public void before() throws Exception {
076    TEST_UTIL.startMiniCluster();
077    TEST_UTIL.createMultiRegionTable(T1, new byte[][] { HConstants.CATALOG_FAMILY });
078    TEST_UTIL.createMultiRegionTable(T2, new byte[][] { HConstants.CATALOG_FAMILY });
079    TEST_UTIL.createMultiRegionTable(T3, new byte[][] { HConstants.CATALOG_FAMILY });
080
081    final byte[][] keysForT4 =
082      { Bytes.toBytes("aa"), Bytes.toBytes("bb"), Bytes.toBytes("cc"), Bytes.toBytes("dd") };
083
084    TEST_UTIL.createTable(T4, HConstants.CATALOG_FAMILY, keysForT4);
085
086    final byte[][] keysForT5 = { Bytes.toBytes("bb"), Bytes.toBytes("cc"), Bytes.toBytes("dd") };
087
088    TEST_UTIL.createTable(T5, HConstants.CATALOG_FAMILY, keysForT5);
089
090    TEST_UTIL.createMultiRegionTable(T6, new byte[][] { HConstants.CATALOG_FAMILY });
091    TEST_UTIL.createMultiRegionTable(T7, new byte[][] { HConstants.CATALOG_FAMILY });
092  }
093
094  @After
095  public void after() throws Exception {
096    TEST_UTIL.shutdownMiniCluster();
097  }
098
099  /**
100   * Fat method where we start with a fat hbase:meta and then gradually intro problems running
101   * catalogjanitor for each to ensure it triggers complaint. Do one big method because takes a
102   * while to build up the context we need. We create three tables and then make holes, overlaps,
103   * add unknown servers and empty out regioninfo columns. Each should up counts in the
104   * CatalogJanitor.Report produced.
105   */
106  @Test
107  public void testConsistency() throws IOException {
108    CatalogJanitor janitor = TEST_UTIL.getHBaseCluster().getMaster().getCatalogJanitor();
109    RegionStateStore regionStateStore =
110      TEST_UTIL.getHBaseCluster().getMaster().getAssignmentManager().getRegionStateStore();
111    janitor.scan();
112    CatalogJanitorReport report = janitor.getLastReport();
113    // Assert no problems.
114    assertTrue(report.isEmpty());
115    // Now remove first region in table t2 to see if catalogjanitor scan notices.
116    List<RegionInfo> t2Ris = MetaTableAccessor.getTableRegions(TEST_UTIL.getConnection(), T2);
117    regionStateStore.deleteRegion(t2Ris.get(0));
118    janitor.scan();
119    report = janitor.getLastReport();
120    assertFalse(report.isEmpty());
121    assertEquals(1, report.getHoles().size());
122    assertTrue(report.getHoles().get(0).getFirst().getTable()
123      .equals(RegionInfoBuilder.UNDEFINED.getTable()));
124    assertTrue(report.getHoles().get(0).getSecond().getTable().equals(T2));
125    assertEquals(0, report.getOverlaps().size());
126    // Next, add overlaps to first row in t3
127    List<RegionInfo> t3Ris = MetaTableAccessor.getTableRegions(TEST_UTIL.getConnection(), T3);
128    RegionInfo ri = t3Ris.get(0);
129    RegionInfo newRi1 = RegionInfoBuilder.newBuilder(ri.getTable())
130      .setStartKey(incrementRow(ri.getStartKey())).setEndKey(incrementRow(ri.getEndKey())).build();
131    Put p1 = MetaTableAccessor.makePutFromRegionInfo(newRi1, EnvironmentEdgeManager.currentTime());
132    RegionInfo newRi2 = RegionInfoBuilder.newBuilder(newRi1.getTable())
133      .setStartKey(incrementRow(newRi1.getStartKey())).setEndKey(incrementRow(newRi1.getEndKey()))
134      .build();
135    Put p2 = MetaTableAccessor.makePutFromRegionInfo(newRi2, EnvironmentEdgeManager.currentTime());
136    MetaTableAccessor.putsToMetaTable(TEST_UTIL.getConnection(), Arrays.asList(p1, p2));
137    janitor.scan();
138    report = janitor.getLastReport();
139    assertFalse(report.isEmpty());
140    // We added two overlaps so total three.
141    assertEquals(3, report.getOverlaps().size());
142    // Assert hole is still there.
143    assertEquals(1, report.getHoles().size());
144    // Assert other attributes are empty still.
145    assertTrue(report.getEmptyRegionInfo().isEmpty());
146    assertTrue(report.getUnknownServers().isEmpty());
147    // Now make bad server in t1.
148    List<RegionInfo> t1Ris = MetaTableAccessor.getTableRegions(TEST_UTIL.getConnection(), T1);
149    RegionInfo t1Ri1 = t1Ris.get(1);
150    Put pServer = new Put(t1Ri1.getRegionName());
151    pServer.addColumn(HConstants.CATALOG_FAMILY, MetaTableAccessor.getServerColumn(0),
152      Bytes.toBytes("bad.server.example.org:1234"));
153    MetaTableAccessor.putsToMetaTable(TEST_UTIL.getConnection(), Arrays.asList(pServer));
154    janitor.scan();
155    report = janitor.getLastReport();
156    assertFalse(report.isEmpty());
157    assertEquals(1, report.getUnknownServers().size());
158    // Test what happens if we blow away an info:server row, if it is null. Should not kill CJ
159    // and we should log the row that had the problem. HBASE-23192. Just make sure we don't
160    // break if this happens.
161    LOG.info("Make null info:server");
162    Put emptyInfoServerPut = new Put(t1Ri1.getRegionName());
163    emptyInfoServerPut.addColumn(HConstants.CATALOG_FAMILY, MetaTableAccessor.getServerColumn(0),
164      Bytes.toBytes(""));
165    MetaTableAccessor.putsToMetaTable(TEST_UTIL.getConnection(), Arrays.asList(emptyInfoServerPut));
166    janitor.scan();
167    report = janitor.getLastReport();
168    assertEquals(0, report.getUnknownServers().size());
169    // Mke an empty regioninfo in t1.
170    RegionInfo t1Ri2 = t1Ris.get(2);
171    Put pEmptyRI = new Put(t1Ri2.getRegionName());
172    pEmptyRI.addColumn(HConstants.CATALOG_FAMILY, HConstants.REGIONINFO_QUALIFIER,
173      HConstants.EMPTY_BYTE_ARRAY);
174    MetaTableAccessor.putsToMetaTable(TEST_UTIL.getConnection(), Arrays.asList(pEmptyRI));
175    janitor.scan();
176    report = janitor.getLastReport();
177    assertEquals(1, report.getEmptyRegionInfo().size());
178
179    int holesReported = report.getHoles().size();
180    int overlapsReported = report.getOverlaps().size();
181
182    // Test the case for T4
183    // r1: [aa, bb), r2: [cc, dd), r3: [a, cc)
184    // Make sure only overlaps and no holes are reported.
185    List<RegionInfo> t4Ris = MetaTableAccessor.getTableRegions(TEST_UTIL.getConnection(), T4);
186    // delete the region [bb, cc)
187    MetaTableAccessor.deleteRegionInfo(TEST_UTIL.getConnection(), t4Ris.get(2));
188
189    // add a new region [a, cc)
190    RegionInfo newRiT4 = RegionInfoBuilder.newBuilder(T4).setStartKey("a".getBytes())
191      .setEndKey("cc".getBytes()).build();
192    Put putForT4 =
193      MetaTableAccessor.makePutFromRegionInfo(newRiT4, EnvironmentEdgeManager.currentTime());
194    MetaTableAccessor.putsToMetaTable(TEST_UTIL.getConnection(), Arrays.asList(putForT4));
195
196    janitor.scan();
197    report = janitor.getLastReport();
198    // there is no new hole reported, 2 more overLaps added.
199    assertEquals(holesReported, report.getHoles().size());
200    assertEquals(overlapsReported + 2, report.getOverlaps().size());
201
202    holesReported = report.getHoles().size();
203    overlapsReported = report.getOverlaps().size();
204
205    // Test the case for T5
206    // r0: [, bb), r1: [a, g), r2: [bb, cc), r3: [dd, )
207    // Make sure only overlaps and no holes are reported.
208    List<RegionInfo> t5Ris = MetaTableAccessor.getTableRegions(TEST_UTIL.getConnection(), T5);
209    // delete the region [cc, dd)
210    MetaTableAccessor.deleteRegionInfo(TEST_UTIL.getConnection(), t5Ris.get(2));
211
212    // add a new region [a, g)
213    RegionInfo newRiT5 = RegionInfoBuilder.newBuilder(T5).setStartKey("a".getBytes())
214      .setEndKey("g".getBytes()).build();
215    Put putForT5 =
216      MetaTableAccessor.makePutFromRegionInfo(newRiT5, EnvironmentEdgeManager.currentTime());
217    MetaTableAccessor.putsToMetaTable(TEST_UTIL.getConnection(), Arrays.asList(putForT5));
218
219    janitor.scan();
220    report = janitor.getLastReport();
221    // there is no new hole reported, 3 more overLaps added.
222    // ([a, g), [, bb)), ([a, g), [bb, cc)), ([a, g), [dd, ))
223    assertEquals(holesReported, report.getHoles().size());
224    assertEquals(overlapsReported + 3, report.getOverlaps().size());
225  }
226
227  /**
228   * Take last byte and add one to it.
229   */
230  private static byte[] incrementRow(byte[] row) {
231    if (row.length == 0) {
232      return new byte[] { '0' };
233    }
234    row[row.length - 1] = (byte) (((int) row[row.length - 1]) + 1);
235    return row;
236  }
237
238  @Test
239  public void testHoles() throws IOException, InterruptedException {
240    CatalogJanitor janitor = TEST_UTIL.getHBaseCluster().getMaster().getCatalogJanitor();
241
242    CatalogJanitorReport report = janitor.getLastReport();
243    // Assert no problems.
244    assertTrue(report.isEmpty());
245    // Verify start and end region holes
246    verifyCornerHoles(janitor, T1);
247    // Verify start and end region holes
248    verifyCornerHoles(janitor, T2);
249    // Verify start and end region holes when next table is disable see: HBASE-27560
250    disableTable(T7);
251    verifyCornerHoles(janitor, T6);
252    verifyMiddleHole(janitor);
253    // Verify that MetaFixer is able to fix these holes
254    fixHoles(janitor);
255  }
256
257  private void fixHoles(CatalogJanitor janitor) throws IOException {
258    MetaFixer metaFixer = new MetaFixer(TEST_UTIL.getHBaseCluster().getMaster());
259    janitor.scan();
260    CatalogJanitorReport report = janitor.getLastReport();
261    // Verify total number of holes, 2 in t1, t2, t6 each and one in t3
262    assertEquals("Number of holes are not matching", 7, report.getHoles().size());
263    metaFixer.fix();
264    janitor.scan();
265    report = janitor.getLastReport();
266    assertEquals("Holes are not fixed", 0, report.getHoles().size());
267  }
268
269  private void verifyMiddleHole(CatalogJanitor janitor) throws IOException {
270    // Verify middle holes
271    RegionInfo firstRegion = getRegionInfo(T3, "".getBytes());
272    RegionInfo secondRegion = getRegionInfo(T3, "bbb".getBytes());
273    RegionInfo thirdRegion = getRegionInfo(T3, "ccc".getBytes());
274    MetaTableAccessor.deleteRegionInfo(TEST_UTIL.getConnection(), secondRegion);
275    LinkedList<Pair<RegionInfo, RegionInfo>> holes = getHoles(janitor, T3);
276    Pair<RegionInfo, RegionInfo> regionInfoRegionInfoPair = holes.getFirst();
277    assertTrue(regionInfoRegionInfoPair.getFirst().getTable().equals(T3));
278    assertTrue(regionInfoRegionInfoPair.getSecond().getTable().equals(T3));
279    assertTrue(
280      regionInfoRegionInfoPair.getFirst().getEncodedName().equals(firstRegion.getEncodedName()));
281    assertTrue(
282      regionInfoRegionInfoPair.getSecond().getEncodedName().equals(thirdRegion.getEncodedName()));
283  }
284
285  private void verifyCornerHoles(CatalogJanitor janitor, TableName tableName) throws IOException {
286    RegionInfo firstRegion = getRegionInfo(tableName, "".getBytes());
287    RegionInfo secondRegion = getRegionInfo(tableName, "bbb".getBytes());
288    MetaTableAccessor.deleteRegionInfo(TEST_UTIL.getConnection(), firstRegion);
289    LinkedList<Pair<RegionInfo, RegionInfo>> holes = getHoles(janitor, tableName);
290
291    assertEquals(1, holes.size());
292    Pair<RegionInfo, RegionInfo> regionInfoRegionInfoPair = holes.get(0);
293    assertTrue(regionInfoRegionInfoPair.getFirst().getTable()
294      .equals(RegionInfoBuilder.UNDEFINED.getTable()));
295    assertTrue(regionInfoRegionInfoPair.getSecond().getTable().equals(tableName));
296    assertTrue(
297      regionInfoRegionInfoPair.getSecond().getEncodedName().equals(secondRegion.getEncodedName()));
298
299    RegionInfo lastRegion = getRegionInfo(tableName, "zzz".getBytes());
300    RegionInfo secondLastRegion = getRegionInfo(tableName, "yyy".getBytes());
301    MetaTableAccessor.deleteRegionInfo(TEST_UTIL.getConnection(), lastRegion);
302    holes = getHoles(janitor, tableName);
303    assertEquals(2, holes.size());
304    regionInfoRegionInfoPair = holes.get(1);
305    assertTrue(regionInfoRegionInfoPair.getFirst().getEncodedName()
306      .equals(secondLastRegion.getEncodedName()));
307    assertTrue(regionInfoRegionInfoPair.getSecond().getTable()
308      .equals(RegionInfoBuilder.UNDEFINED.getTable()));
309  }
310
311  // Get Holes filter by table
312  private LinkedList<Pair<RegionInfo, RegionInfo>> getHoles(CatalogJanitor janitor,
313    TableName tableName) throws IOException {
314    janitor.scan();
315    CatalogJanitorReport lastReport = janitor.getLastReport();
316    assertFalse(lastReport.isEmpty());
317    LinkedList<Pair<RegionInfo, RegionInfo>> holes = new LinkedList<>();
318    for (Pair<RegionInfo, RegionInfo> hole : lastReport.getHoles()) {
319      if (
320        hole.getFirst().getTable().equals(tableName)
321          || hole.getSecond().getTable().equals(tableName)
322      ) {
323        holes.add(hole);
324      }
325    }
326    return holes;
327  }
328
329  private RegionInfo getRegionInfo(TableName tableName, byte[] row) throws IOException {
330    RegionInfo regionInfo =
331      TEST_UTIL.getConnection().getRegionLocator(tableName).getRegionLocation(row).getRegion();
332    assertNotNull(regionInfo);
333    return regionInfo;
334  }
335
336  private void disableTable(TableName tableName) throws IOException, InterruptedException {
337    try {
338      TEST_UTIL.getAdmin().disableTable(tableName);
339      TEST_UTIL.waitTableDisabled(tableName, 30000);
340    } catch (TableNotEnabledException e) {
341      LOG.debug("Table: " + tableName + " already disabled, ignore.");
342    }
343  }
344}
